definitions.definition: the place where something or someone is, often in relation to other things:
examples: Well, I've found our position on the map if you want to see where we are.

definitions.definition: (in team sports) the part someone plays in a game, relating to the area of the field in which they mostly play:
examples: I didn't know you played hockey - what position do you play?

definitions.definition: the place where people are sent in order to carry out a course of action:
examples: The troops took up their battle positions at the front line.

definitions.definition: to put something or someone in a particular place:
examples: The army had been positioned to the north and east of the city.
